method.name: Add
method.comment: Adds the specified amount to a {@code Calendar} field. field: the {@code Calendar} field to modify. value: the amount to add to the field.

method.name: ToString2
method.comment: Returns the string representation of this {@code Calendar}.

method.name: Set
method.comment: Sets a field to the specified value. field: the code indicating the {@code Calendar} field to modify. value: the value.

method.name: getGreatestMinimum
method.comment: Gets the greatest minimum value of the specified field. This is the biggest value that {@code getActualMinimum} can return for any possible time. field: the field. Return type: @return:the greatest minimum value of the specified field.

method.name: roll
method.comment: Adds the specified amount to the specified field and wraps the value of the field when it goes beyond the maximum or minimum value for the current date. Other fields will be adjusted as required to maintain a consistent date. field: the field to roll. value: the amount to add.

method.name: getMaximum
method.comment: Gets the greatest maximum value of the specified field. This returns the biggest value that {@code get} can return for the specified field. field: the field. Return type: @return:the greatest maximum value of the specified field.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Constructs a new instance of the {@code Calendar} subclass appropriate for the default {@code Locale}. Return type: @return:a {@code Calendar} subclass instance set to the current date and time in the default {@code Timezone}.

method.name: SetFirstDayOfWeek
method.comment: Sets the first day of the week for this {@code Calendar}. value: a {@code Calendar} day of the week.

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Clears all of the fields of this {@code Calendar}. All fields are initialized to zero.

method.name: SetMinimalDaysInFirstWeek
method.comment: Sets the minimal days in the first week of the year. value: the minimal days in the first week of the year.

method.name: Set4
method.comment: Sets the year, month, day of the month, hour of day, minute and second fields. Other fields are not changed. year: the year. month: the month. day: the day of the month. hourOfDay: the hour of day. minute: the minute. second: the second.

method.name: Set3
method.comment: Sets the year, month, day of the month, hour of day and minute fields. Other fields are not changed. year: the year. month: the month. day: the day of the month. hourOfDay: the hour of day. minute: the minute.

method.name: SetTimeZone
method.comment: Sets the {@code TimeZone} used by this Calendar. timezone: a {@code TimeZone}.

method.name: get
method.comment: Gets the value of the specified field after computing the field values by calling {@code complete()} first. field: the field to get. Return type: @return:the value of the specified field.

method.name: Set2
method.comment: Sets the year, month and day of the month fields. Other fields are not changed. year: the year. month: the month. day: the day of the month.

method.name: getMinimum
method.comment: Gets the smallest minimum value of the specified field. this returns the smallest value thet {@code get} can return for the specified field. field: the field number. Return type: @return:the smallest minimum value of the specified field.

method.name: getLeastMaximum
method.comment: Gets the smallest maximum value of the specified field. This is the smallest value that {@code getActualMaximum()} can return for any possible time. field: the field number. Return type: @return:the smallest maximum value of the specified field.

method.name: SetTime
method.comment: Sets the time of this {@code Calendar}. date: a {@code Date} object.

method.name: getActualMinimum
method.comment: Gets the minimum value of the specified field for the current date. field: the field. Return type: @return:the minimum value of the specified field.

method.name: roll2
method.comment: Increment or decrement the specified field and wrap the value of the field when it goes beyond the maximum or minimum value for the current date. Other fields will be adjusted as required to maintain a consistent date. field: the number indicating the field to roll. increment: {@code true} to increment the field, {@code false} to decrement.

method.name: Initialize4
method.comment: Constructs a new instance of the {@code Calendar} subclass appropriate for the specified {@code Locale}. timezone: the {@code TimeZone} to use. locale: the {@code Locale} to use. Return type: @return:a {@code Calendar} subclass instance set to the current date and time in the specified timezone.

method.name: Initialize3
method.comment: Constructs a new instance of the {@code Calendar} subclass appropriate for the default {@code Locale}, using the specified {@code TimeZone}. timezone: the {@code TimeZone} to use. Return type: @return:a {@code Calendar} subclass instance set to the current date and time in the specified timezone.

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Constructs a new instance of the {@code Calendar} subclass appropriate for the specified {@code Locale}. locale: the locale to use. Return type: @return:a {@code Calendar} subclass instance set to the current date and time.

method.name: getDisplayName
method.comment:
Returns a human-readable string for the value of {@code field} using the given style and locale. If no string is available, returns null. The value is retrieved by invoking {@code get(field)}.

For example, {@code getDisplayName(MONTH, SHORT, Locale.US)} will return "Jan" while {@code getDisplayName(MONTH, LONG, Locale.US)} will return "January". field: the field style: {@code SHORT} or {@code LONG} locale: the locale Return type: @return:the display name, or null

method.name: SetTimeInMillis
method.comment: Sets the time of this {@code Calendar}. milliseconds: the time as the number of milliseconds since Jan. 1, 1970.

method.name: ToString
method.comment: Returns the string representation of this {@code Calendar}.

property.name: DayOfWeekValue
property.comment: Set/Get calendar day of week value (sunday...saturday)

property.name: DayOfWeekInMonthValue
property.comment: Set/Get calendar day of week in month value

property.name: TimeInMillis
property.comment: Computes the time from the fields if required and returns the time.

property.name: Time
property.comment: Gets the time of this {@code Calendar} as a {@code Date} object.

property.name: DayOfMonthValue
property.comment: Set/Get calendar day of month value

property.name: DayOfYearValue
property.comment: Set/Get calendar day of year value

property.name: TimeZone
property.comment: Gets the timezone of this {@code Calendar}.

property.name: AvailableLocales
property.comment:
Returns an array of locales for which custom {@code Calendar} instances are available.

Note that Android does not support user-supplied locale service providers.

property.name: MinimalDaysInFirstWeek
property.comment: Gets the minimal days in the first week of the year.

property.name: FirstDayOfWeek
property.comment: Gets the first day of the week for this {@code Calendar}.

field.name: DAY_OF_YEAR
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the day number within the current year. The first day of the year has value 1.

field.name: MONTH
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the month. This is a calendar-specific value. The first month of the year is {@code JANUARY}; the last depends on the number of months in a year.

field.name: THURSDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Thursday.

field.name: MAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the fifth month of the year.

field.name: DAY_OF_MONTH
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the day of the month. This is a synonym for {@code DATE}. The first day of the month has value 1.

field.name: HOUR
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the hour of the morning or afternoon. {@code HOUR} is used for the 12-hour clock. E.g., at 10:04:15.250 PM the {@code HOUR} is 10.

field.name: WEEK_OF_MONTH
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the week number within the current month. The first week of the month, as defined by {@code getFirstDayOfWeek()} and {@code getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek()}, has value 1. Subclasses define the value of {@code WEEK_OF_MONTH} for days before the first week of the month.

field.name: DECEMBER
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the twelfth month of the year.

field.name: FRIDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Friday.

field.name: AM_PM
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating whether the {@code HOUR} is before or after noon. E.g., at 10:04:15.250 PM the {@code AM_PM} is {@code PM}.

field.name: FEBRUARY
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the second month of the year.

field.name: ALL_STYLES
field.comment: Requests both {@code SHORT} and {@code LONG} styles in the map returned by {@link #getDisplayNames}.

field.name: DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the ordinal number of the day of the week within the current month. Together with the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field, this uniquely specifies a day within a month. Unlike {@code WEEK_OF_MONTH} and {@code WEEK_OF_YEAR}, this field's value does not depend on {@code getFirstDayOfWeek()} or {@code getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek()}. {@code DAY_OF_MONTH 1} through {@code 7} always correspond to DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 1; {@code 8} through {@code 15} correspond to {@code DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 2}, and so on. {@code DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 0} indicates the week before {@code DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 1}. Negative values count back from the end of the month, so the last Sunday of a month is specified as {@code DAY_OF_WEEK = SUNDAY, DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH = -1}. Because negative values count backward they will usually be aligned differently within the month than positive values. For example, if a month has 31 days, {@code DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH -1} will overlap {@code DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 5} and the end of {@code 4}.

field.name: ZONE_OFFSET
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the raw offset from GMT in milliseconds.

field.name: WEDNESDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Wednesday.

field.name: YEAR
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the year. This is a calendar-specific value; see subclass documentation.

field.name: WEEK_OF_YEAR
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the week number within the current year. The first week of the year, as defined by {@code getFirstDayOfWeek()} and {@code getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek()}, has value 1. Subclasses define the value of {@code WEEK_OF_YEAR} for days before the first week of the year.

field.name: FIELD_COUNT
field.comment: This is the total number of fields in this calendar.

field.name: UNDECIMBER
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the thirteenth month of the year. Although {@code GregorianCalendar} does not use this value, lunar calendars do.

field.name: HOUR_OF_DAY
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the hour of the day. {@code HOUR_OF_DAY} is used for the 24-hour clock. E.g., at 10:04:15.250 PM the {@code HOUR_OF_DAY} is 22.

field.name: SATURDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Saturday.

field.name: MINUTE
APRIL
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the fourth month of the year.

field.name: LONG
field.comment: Requests long names (such as "January") from {@link #getDisplayName} or {@link #getDisplayNames}.

field.name: JANUARY
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the first month of the year.

field.name: JUNE
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the sixth month of the year.

field.name: DST_OFFSET
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the daylight savings offset in milliseconds.

field.name: SUNDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Sunday.

field.name: OCTOBER
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the tenth month of the year.

field.name: TUESDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Tuesday.

field.name: SEPTEMBER
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the ninth month of the year.

field.name: NOVEMBER
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the eleventh month of the year.

field.name: AM
field.comment: Value of the {@code AM_PM} field indicating the period of the day from midnight to just before noon.

field.name: SHORT
field.comment: Requests short names (such as "Jan") from {@link #getDisplayName} or {@link #getDisplayNames}.

field.name: DATE
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the day of the month. This is a synonym for {@code DAY_OF_MONTH}. The first day of the month has value 1.

field.name: MONDAY
field.comment: Value of the {@code DAY_OF_WEEK} field indicating Monday.

field.name: ERA
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the era, e.g., AD or BC in the Julian calendar. This is a calendar-specific value; see subclass documentation.

field.name: MARCH
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the third month of the year.

field.name: AUGUST
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the eighth month of the year.

field.name: JULY
field.comment: Value of the {@code MONTH} field indicating the seventh month of the year.

field.name: SECOND
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the second within the minute. E.g., at 10:04:15.250 PM the {@code SECOND} is 15.

field.name: DAY_OF_WEEK
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the day of the week. This field takes values {@code SUNDAY}, {@code MONDAY}, {@code TUESDAY}, {@code WEDNESDAY}, {@code THURSDAY}, {@code FRIDAY}, and {@code SATURDAY}.

field.name: MILLISECOND
field.comment: Field number for {@code get} and {@code set} indicating the millisecond within the second. E.g., at 10:04:15.250 PM the {@code MILLISECOND} is 250.

field.name: PM
field.comment: Value of the {@code AM_PM} field indicating the period of the day from noon to just before midnight.
